body:
I've an application where, for testing, I need to replace the time.time() call with a specific timestamp, I've done that in the past using ruby 

(code available here: [http://github.com/zemariamm/Back-to-Future/blob/master/back_to_future.rb](http://github.com/zemariamm/Back-to-Future/blob/master/back_to_future.rb) )

However I do not know how to do this using Python.

Any hints ?
Cheers,
Ze Maria
title: monkey patching time.time() in python
